objects.name: Analytic 1307
objects.description: macOS environmental keying behavioral chain: (1) System information discovery through native utilities (system_profiler, sw_vers, hostname, dscl) and Security framework queries, (2) Hardware and software enumeration including serial numbers, installed applications, and system versions, (3) Network configuration assessment (networksetup, scutil) and wireless network discovery, (4) Keychain and security context validation, (5) Unified Logs correlation with cryptographic framework usage (CommonCrypto, Security.framework), (6) Application bundle execution following environmental validation

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: process execution events for discovery utilities (system_profiler, sw_vers, dscl, networksetup) with command-line parameter analysis

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Security framework operations including keychain access, cryptographic operations, and certificate validation

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: fs:fsevents
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: file system events indicating access to system configuration files and environmental information sources

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Specific system_profiler data types that adversaries commonly target (SPHardwareDataType, SPSoftwareDataType, SPNetworkDataType) - customize based on threat intelligence
Security.framework and CommonCrypto API usage patterns indicating cryptographic operations for environmental keying
Time window for correlating discovery activities with subsequent cryptographic operations - balance between detection coverage and log volume
Specific application bundle paths and identifiers that might be subject to environmental validation
Organization-specific network configurations, WiFi SSIDs, and network services that adversaries might validate against
Expected macOS versions and configurations in environment to identify version-specific environmental targeting
File system event filtering criteria to focus on security-relevant file access patterns while managing event volume
